means: satellite positioning and tracking 卫星定位和跟踪
Satellite Positioning and Tracking 人造卫星定位及跟踪

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"地点，位置，场所"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: place, position, spot, situation, site, location, locality, setting, scene
means: place ： 含义广泛，最普通用词，既可指很小的地点，又可指很大很远的地方或场所。
position ： 多指物体相对于其他物体所处的位置或状态。
spot ： 指相对较小的特定地点或事物所在地。
situation ： 指物体在其周围环境中所处的位置或状态，侧重地点或场所的环境特征。
site ： 指或大或小的地方，既可指供专门用途或特定活动的地点，又可指某一事件的地址。
location ： 指某物设置的方向或地点。
locality ： 指某物所处的客观位置和周围地区。
setting ： 一般特指戏剧或小说所写的环境或场所。
scene ： 常指真实事件或虚构故事发生的地点。

word_mean: 点，斑：局部颜色不同之处，同loculus或macula，另见tache

sentence.Network_en: McGregor's effort was enough to edge Johnson out of the top spot.
sentence.Network_cn: 麦格雷戈奋力一搏，成功地将约翰逊从第一的位置上挤了下来。

sentence.Network_en: Schools were told their exam information had to be spot-on and accurate.
sentence.Network_cn: 各学校接到通知，要求考试信息必须准确无误。

sentence.Network_en: Even clever people are not terribly clever when put on the spot.
sentence.Network_cn: 即便是聪明人在面对难题时也未必就能表现得特别聪明。

lj.lj_ly: the cup of coffee hit the spot.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)force someone into a situation in which they must make a difficult decision or answer a difficult question
Now and then; here and there; occasionally.
Under pressure or attention; in a pressed position.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 有压力的：在注意下或压力下；在有压力位置上

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: perhaps from Middle Dutch spotte. The sense 'notice, recognize' arose from the early 19th-cent. slang use 'note as a suspect or criminal'

entry.def: Spots are small, round, coloured areas on a surface.

example.ex: The leaves have yellow areas on the top and underneath are powdery orange spots...
example.tran: 叶子的表面有黄色斑块，背面则有桔色粉状圆点。

example.ex: The swimsuit comes in navy with white spots or blue with green spots.
example.tran: 这款泳衣有藏青色带白色圆点的，也有蓝色带绿色圆点的。

entry.def: Spots on a person's skin are small lumps or marks.

example.ex: Never squeeze blackheads, spots or pimples.
example.tran: 千万不要挤黑头、小肿块或粉刺。

entry.def: A spot of a liquid is a small amount of it.

example.ex: Spots of rain had begun to fall...
Secure with a few spots of glue.

entry.def: If you have a spot of something, you have a small amount of it.

example.ex: Mr Brooke is undoubtedly in a spot of bother...
example.tran: 布鲁克先生肯定遇到了点小麻烦。

example.ex: A year or two ago I found myself indulging in a spot of yachting in Finnish waters...
example.tran: 一两年前，我有一阵子曾迷上了在芬兰海域中进行帆船运动。

entry.def: You can refer to a particular place as a spot .

example.ex: They stayed at several of the island's top tourist spots...
example.tran: 他们在岛上最著名的几处旅游景点作了停留。

example.ex: They all stood there staring, as if frozen to the spot.
example.tran: 他们都站在那儿发愣，就像被冻在那里似的。

entry.def: A spot in a television or radio show is a part of it that is regularly reserved for a particular performer or type of entertainment.

example.ex: Unsuccessful at screen writing, he got a spot on a CNN film show.
example.tran: 写电影剧本未获成功后，他在美国有线新闻网的一档电影节目中争取到了一个固定时段。

entry.def: If you spot something or someone, you notice them.

example.ex: Vicenzo failed to spot the error...
example.tran: 维森佐未能发现该错误。

example.ex: He left the party seconds before smoke was spotted coming up the stairs.
example.tran: 就在他离开聚会几秒钟后有人发现烟雾顺着楼梯冒上来了。

entry.def: If you are on the spot, you are at the actual place where something is happening.

example.ex: ...areas where troops are on the spot and protecting civilians...
example.tran: 有部队在现场保护平民的地区

example.ex: Mr Connolly is their 'man on the spot' and the person you can call if you have a complaint.
example.tran: 康诺利先生是他们的“现场代表”，要投诉可以和他联系。

entry.def: If you do something on the spot, you do it immediately.

example.ex: James was called to see the producer and got the job on the spot...
example.tran: 詹姆斯被叫去见制片人，当场就得到了那份工作。

example.ex: The surveyor will use a laptop computer to give on the spot advice.
example.tran: 检测员会用一台手提电脑当场给出意见。

entry.def: If you put someone on the spot, you cause them to have to answer a difficult question or make a difficult decision.

example.ex: He put me on the spot a bit because he invited me right in front of his mum and I didn't particularly want to go...
example.tran: 他让我有点难堪，因为他当着他母亲的面邀请我，而我又不太想去。

example.ex: Even clever people are not terribly clever when put on the spot.
example.tran: 即便是聪明人在面对难题时也未必就能表现得特别聪明。

entry.def: If you are in a tight spot, you are in a difficult situation.

example.ex: In a tight spot there is no one I would sooner see than Frank.
example.tran: 有麻烦时，我会首先去找弗兰克。

means.word_mean: 1. a point located with respect to surface features of some region;

sentences.sentence: "this is a nice place for a picnic"

means.word_mean: 2. a short section or illustration (as between radio or tv programs or in a magazine) that is often used for advertising

sentences.sentence: "he had a smudge on his cheek"

means.word_mean: 4. a small contrasting part of something;
5. a section of an entertainment that is assigned to a specific performer or performance;

sentences.sentence: "they changed his spot on the program"
"his acting was one of the high points of the movie"
"he occupied a post in the treasury"

means.word_mean: 11. a mark on a playing card (shape depending on the suit)
12. a lamp that produces a strong beam of light to illuminate a restricted area; used to focus attention of a stage performer
13. a playing card with a specified number of pips on it to indicate its value;
14. an act that brings discredit to the person who does it;

sentences.sentence: "he made a huge blot on his copybook"

means.word_mean: 2. mar or impair with a flaw;
3. make a spot or mark onto;
5. mark with a spot or spots so as to allow easy recognition;

sentences.sentence: "spot the areas that one should clearly identify"

Sentence.sentence: As well as the background checks carried out by platform owners, online reviews and ratings are usually posted by both parties to each transaction, which makes it easy to spot bad drivers, bathrobe-thieves and surfboard-wreckers
It's possible to admire Oprah Winfrey and still wish Harvard hadn't awarded her an honorary doctor of law degree and the commencement(毕业典礼)speaker spot at yesterday's graduation.
A woman holds the top spot at the International Monetary Fund; another won the Nobel Prize in economics.
Its clean air, attractive parks, and the absence of any industry, make this an ideal spot for people looking for a quiet life.

sentences.en: You have a grease spot on your shirt.
Let's meet at this spot tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 明天我们就在这个地方见面吧。

sentences.en: I spotted him in the crowd.
How did you spot those fifties were counterfeited?
sentences.cn: 你怎样察觉出那些50元面值的纸币是伪造的?

sentences.en: He spotted his family's reputation by hanging about with a street girl.
sentences.cn: 他与一个妓女鬼混败坏了他家族的名声。

means.word_mean: 把…放到特定的地点(或位置)上；【台球】把(台球)放在置球点上

sentences.en: All the bugs were spotted at their suitable positions.
sentences.cn: 所有的窃听器都安置到适当隐蔽的位置上了。

sentences.en: They spotted the wall with green paint.
sentences.cn: 他们用绿色涂料装饰墙壁。

sentences.en: It spots in London in Spring.
sentences.cn: 伦敦的春天总是下间断性的小雨。

jushi.english: You have a grease spot on your shirt.
You are afraid there's been a spot of bother.
Let's meet at this spot tomorrow.
jushi.chinese: 明天我们就在这个地方见面吧。
